event.title: recognized by the municipality of Cabadbaran as barrio Santiago, However, in 1924

data.event: Curva Jagupit Lapaz Poblacion I San Isidro Tagbuyacan Estanislao Morgado Poblacion II Pangaylan IP In the later part of 1898, a group of natives fleeing from the municipality of Jabonga settled in a place recognized by the municipality of Cabadbaran as barrio Santiago, However, in 1924 the Aciga River swelled its banks, destroying all properties, crops and animals along it.

event.title: 1936, the same Aciga River wrought damage which made

data.event: In 1936, the same Aciga River wrought damage which made the inhabitants decide to transfer at the foot of the hill, particularly at Sitio Paypay, which was inhabited by two groups of natives-the Manobos and the Mamanwas, then.
Towards the end of 1936, thru a bill sponsored by the late Congressman Calo, the name Paypay was changed to Santiago in honor of Senior Santiago or Saint James.
